text: The Battle of São Mamede (, ) took place on 24 June 1128 near Guimarães and is an important event for the foundation of the Kingdom of Portugal and the battle that helped Portugal's Independence. Portuguese forces led by Afonso Henriques defeated forces led by his mother Teresa of Portugal and Fernão Peres de Trava. Following São Mamede, the future king styled himself "Prince of Portugal". He would be called "King of Portugal" starting in 1139 and was recognised by neighbouring kingdoms in 1143. == Other websites == * * Portugal Chronology World History Database * History of Portugal: Primary documents Category:1128 Category:Battles Category:12th century in Portugal
title: Battle of São Mamede
